title: The Raveonettes
comment: /* Soundtracks and compilations */ Fixed-up link to Stubbs
text:
{{Short description|Danish indie rock duo}} {{Use dmy dates|date=December 2020}} {{more citations needed|date=June 2013}} {{Infobox musical artist | name = The Raveonettes | image = The Raveonettes 2 by David Shankbone.jpg | caption = | image_size = 200px | landscape = yes | background = group_or_band | origin = [[Copenhagen]], Denmark | genre = [[Indie rock]],{{cite web|url=http://www.clashmusic.com/artists/the-raveonettes|title=The Raveonettes – A Class Act|website=[[Clash Magazine|Clash]]|archive-date=21 November 2014|archive-url=https://web.archive.org/web/20141121125305/http://www.clashmusic.com/artists/the-raveonettes|access-date=29 April 2018|url-status=dead}} [[noise pop]], [[garage rock]], [[shoegazing]], [[post-punk revival]] | years_active = 2001–2018, 2022-Present | label = [[Crunchy Frog]]
[[Columbia Records]]
[[Fierce Panda Records]]
[[Vice Records]]
[[Universal Music Group]] | website = http://www.theraveonettes.com/ | current_members = [[Sune Rose Wagner]]
[[Sharin Foo]] }} '''The Raveonettes''' are a [[Denmark|Danish]] [[indie rock]] duo, consisting of [[Sune Rose Wagner]] on [[guitar]], [[musical instrument|instruments]] and vocals, and [[Sharin Foo]] on [[bass guitar|bass]], guitar and vocals. Their music is characterized by close two-part vocal harmonies inspired by [[The Everly Brothers]]{{cite web|url=https://www.npr.org/templates/story/story.php?storyId=16151932 |title=The Raveonettes |publisher=Npr.org |access-date=2012-04-23}} coupled with hard-edged electric guitar overlaid with liberal doses of noise.Nay, Rob.[https://archive.today/20120703161534/http://exclaim.ca/articles/multiarticlesub.aspx?csid1=119&csid2=4&fid1=29855 "The Raveonettes’ Buddy System"], ''[[Exclaim!]]'', March 2008. Their songs juxtapose the structural and chordal simplicity of 1950s and 1960s rock with intense electric instrumentation, driving beats, and often dark lyrical content (e.g., crime, drugs, murder, suicide, love, lust, and betrayal), similar to another of the band's influences, [[The Velvet Underground]].{{citation needed|date=August 2014}} == Biography == === Early years === [[File:The Raveonettes.jpg|thumb|left|The Raveonettes playing at The Music Box @ The Fonda]] The duo met in [[Copenhagen]] and, after forming the band, began recording ''[[Whip It On]]'' at Once Was & Sauna Recording Studio, a former [[Sony]] Studios facility. They booked the studio for three weeks during non-session down time late in 2001 and handled all production chores by themselves. Adding guitarist Manoj Ramdas and [[jazz]] drummer Jakob Hoyer, The Raveonettes booked one of their first gigs at the [[Spot (music festival)|SPOT festival]] in [[Aarhus]], the second largest city in [[Denmark]]. After the release of ''Whip It On'' on the seminal Danish Crunchy Frog label, Hoyer and Ramdas would contribute to the next three Raveonettes albums, along with other additional musicians. However, by the time ''[[Lust Lust Lust]]'' was released in 2007, Sune and Sharin would be the only two musicians credited, showing a return to the dynamic around the time of the mini-album. Officially,{{According to whom|date=March 2022}}the band was discovered by ''[[Rolling Stone]]'' editor [[David Fricke]] at the SPOT festival, and his rave review of the duo immediately resulted in a number of offers from major labels. Unofficially, the band discovered that David Fricke would be present at the SPOT festival, and they rushed a band together and headed for the festival.{{Citation Needed|date=March 2022}} The band is managed by [[Richard Gottehrer]], who has been with them from the start. ''[[Whip It On]]'' was named "Best Rock Album of the Year" at the [[Danish Music Awards]] (Denmark's [[Grammy Award|Grammy]] equivalent) on 1 March 2003, while The Raveonettes were picked by ''[[Rolling Stone]]'' and ''[[Q Magazine]]'' as being among the harbingers of the "Next Wave" of contemporary music. In 2006, ''[[Blender (magazine)|Blender]]'' named Sharin Foo one of rock's hottest women, alongside [[Courtney Love]], [[Joan Jett]] and [[Liz Phair]].{{cite news|last=Errico |first=Mike |url=http://www.blender.com/guide/articles.aspx?ID=2295&src=blender_ed |title=Hottest Women of...Rock |publisher=Blender Magazine Online |date=December 2006 |access-date=2007-02-09 |url-status=dead |archive-url=https://web.archive.org/web/20070210001725/http://www.blender.com/guide/articles.aspx?id=2295 |archive-date=10 February 2007 }} === ''Chain Gang of Love'' === The band's first full-length album, ''[[Chain Gang of Love]]'', was produced by [[Richard Gottehrer]] and The Raveonettes' own Sune Rose Wagner. The album was recorded in Denmark and New York from 9–17 October, 6–12 November, and 4–10 December 2002, and mixed in London in early 2003. The thirteen songs on ''Chain Gang of Love'' are written by Sune Rose Wagner with the exception of "That Great Love Sound", which Sune co-wrote with Gottehrer. Portions of this song were featured in a U.S. ad for [[Kmart (United States)|Kmart]]. The album is notable in that all the songs were written in the key B-flat major. === ''Pretty in Black'' === The band's follow-up album, ''[[Pretty in Black]]'', broadened their musical palette, featuring guest vocals from [[Ronnie Spector]] of [[The Ronettes]] as well as guest instrumental spots from [[Maureen Tucker]] (of [[The Velvet Underground]]) and [[Martin Rev]] (of [[Suicide (band)|Suicide]]). This was their first album in which Sharin Foo did not play bass; instead, The Raveonettes added bass player Anders Christensen, who had toured with seminal jazz drummer [[Paul Motian]], amongst others. Christensen recorded on the album and toured with the band. At the end of the 2005 tour, guitar player Manoj Ramdas left the band to concentrate on his new band SPEKTR. The video for the single "Love in a Trashcan", directed by [[Peder Pedersen (director)|Peder Pedersen]], features pink bars and blocks with words like "Vamp" and "Teaser" scrolling by the band members, and is reminiscent of an early-1960s cosmetic ad. === ''Lust Lust Lust'' === The duo's third studio album, ''[[Lust Lust Lust]]'', was released in November 2007 in Europe and February 2008 in the U.S. The album received generally positive reviews, with the ''[[NME]]'''s Hardeep Phull describing it as "their most engrossing album."{{cite web|url=http://www.nme.com/reviews/the-raveonettes/9219 |title=The Raveonettes – The Raveonettes – Album Reviews – |work=NME|date=2007-11-09 |access-date=2014-04-26}} In December 2008, Sune Rose Wagner released a solo album, simply titled ''Sune Rose Wagner''. All of the songs are sung in his native language of Danish.{{cite web |last=Thiessen |first=Brock |url=http://exclaim.ca/articles/generalarticlesynopsfullart.aspx?csid2=844&fid1=35348&csid1=0 |archive-url=https://archive.today/20120709042750/http://exclaim.ca/articles/generalarticlesynopsfullart.aspx?csid2=844&fid1=35348&csid1=0 |url-status=dead |archive-date=2012-07-09 |title=– Sune Rose Wagner |publisher=Exclaim.ca |date=2008-12-10 |access-date=2014-04-26 }} === ''In and Out of Control'' === The Raveonettes' fourth album, ''[[In and Out of Control]]'', was released 6 October 2009, with "Last Dance" released as the lead-off single. The album was co-written and produced by [[Thomas Troelsen]]. Both "Last Dance" and "Suicide", another song from the album, have been featured on The CW's [[Gossip Girl (TV series)|''Gossip Girl'']].{{cite web|url=http://www.cwtv.com/thecw/ggmusic |title=Gossip Girl Music | Season 5 – Episode 20 |publisher=Cwtv.com |access-date=2012-04-23}} ===''Raven in the Grave''=== ''[[Raven in the Grave]]'', The Raveonettes fifth album, was released 4 April 2011. The album has produced three singles to date. ===''Observator''=== The duo released a new album, titled ''[[Observator]]'', on 11 September 2012.{{cite web |title=Review – The Raveonettes – Observator |url=http://nymn.com/review-the-raveonettes-observator/ | archive-url=https://web.archive.org/web/20120926030757/http://nymn.com/review-the-raveonettes-observator/ | url-status=dead | archive-date=2012-09-26 |publisher=Nymn.com |date=17 September 2012 |access-date=22 September 2012}}{{cite web|last=Noel |first=Alyssa |url=https://www.spin.com/2012/06/raveonettes-celebrate-10th-anniversary-new-lp-observator/ |title=The Raveonettes Celebrate 10th Anniversary With New LP 'Observator' | SPIN | Newswire |work=Spin|date=13 June 2012 |access-date=2012-12-24}}{{cite web |url=http://mp396.com/observator-by-raveonettes.html |title=Observator by Raveonettes |website=Mp396.com |access-date=2011-09-01 |url-status=dead |archive-url=https://web.archive.org/web/20131228015015/http://mp396.com/observator-by-raveonettes.html |archive-date=28 December 2013}} The lead single 'Observations' was released 25 June.{{cite web|url=https://itunes.apple.com/gb/album/id536703848?affId=2122161 |title=iTunes – Music – Observations – Single by The Raveonettes |publisher=Itunes.apple.com |date=25 June 2012 |access-date=2012-12-24}} The second single 'She Owns the Streets' was released 9 July.{{cite web|url=https://itunes.apple.com/album/she-owns-the-streets-single/id538244604?v0=9988&ign-mpt=uo%3D1 |title=iTunes – Music – She Owns the Streets – Single by The Raveonettes |publisher=Itunes.apple.com |date=9 July 2012 |access-date=2012-12-24}} ===''Pe'ahi''=== The band's seventh album, ''[[Pe'ahi (album)|Pe'ahi]]'', was released 22 July 2014. Due to the purposeful lack of promotion or formal announcement of a release date the album was dubbed a "surprise" release.{{cite web|url=http://consequenceofsound.net/2014/07/the-raveonettes-release-surprise-new-album-peahi-listen-to-two-songs/|title=The Raveonettes release surprise album Pe'ahi|author=Chris Coplan|date=22 July 2014|publisher=[[Consequence of Sound]]|access-date=2014-07-22}} ===''2016 Atomized'' (Anti-Album), hiatus and return=== In 2015 the band announced the Rave-Sound-of-the-Month saying that in every month of 2016 the band were recording and releasing a new song. Dubbed by the band as the ''Anti-Album'', the twelve songs were released individually for download online in each month of the year and were released 21 April 2017 as a full album titled ''[[2016 Atomized]]''.{{cite web|url=http://thearkofmusic.com/the-raveonettes-2016-atomized/ |title=The Raveonettes - 2016 Atomized - Album Review | The Ark of Music - The best music in the world...you never knew existed |publisher=The Ark of Music|date=2017-02-20 |access-date=2017-07-15}} In March 2018 the band surprise released a song called "Ghost", a previously unreleased track from 2016 Atomized.{{Cite web |url=https://www.pastemagazine.com/articles/2018/03/daily-dose-the-raveonettes-ghost.html |title=Daily Dose: The Raveonettes, "Ghost" :: Music :: Features :: The Raveonettes :: Paste |access-date=20 March 2018 |archive-date=20 March 2018 |archive-url=https://web.archive.org/web/20180320230747/https://www.pastemagazine.com/articles/2018/03/daily-dose-the-raveonettes-ghost.html |url-status=dead }} The duo are also set to embark on an indefinite hiatus to allow Sune to release a solo album in 2018.{{Cite web|url=https://www.instagram.com/accounts/login/|title=Login • Instagram|website=Instagram.com|access-date=21 November 2020}}In November 2020, the band released the song "Snowstorm", their first release in over two years.{{Cite web|url=https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=95TksESFGvY |archive-url=https://ghostarchive.org/varchive/youtube/20211212/95TksESFGvY| archive-date=2021-12-12 |url-status=live|title = The Raveonettes - SNOWSTORM [LYRIC VIDEO]|website = [[YouTube]]}}{{cbignore}} The band returned to touring in 2022, performing their EP [[Whip It On]] in full at various festivals throughout the summer. New music is also in the works. == Instruments == During live performances, the band usually utilizes [[Fender Musical Instruments Corporation|Fender]] instruments (Sune uses a number of [[Jazzmaster]]s while Sharin opts for either Mustang or jazz bass, and a Jazzmaster). Sune plays a number of different guitars and basses on their albums, including different Fenders, [[Gibson Guitar Corporation|Gibson]]s, and [[Gretsch]]es. In the fall of 2005, the tour van containing the band's equipment (including Sune's prized 1960 Jazzmaster and Sharin's treasured [[Gretsch 6120]]) was stolen during their tour of the U.S.A. On their 2007 tour, the band used the following effects pedals:{{cite web|url=http://guitargeek.com/chat/showthread.php?threadid=27551 |title=The Raveonettes – GeekChat! |website=Guitargeek.com |access-date=2012-04-23}} Sune: * Electro-Harmonx Pulsar * ProCo Rat Distortion * Boss Mega Distortion MD-2 * Dunlop Jimi Hendrix Octave Fuzz * Boss Digital Reverb RV-2 & RV-5 * Danelectro Spring King * Boss Chromatic Tuner TU-2 Sharin: * Boss TR-2 Tremolo * ProCo Rat Distortion * Boss Digital Reverb RV-5 (3x) * Zvex Fuzz Factory Vexter * Boss Chromatic Tuner TU-2 == Band line-up by album == === ''Chain Gang of Love'' line-up === * Sune Rose Wagner: guitars and vocals * Sharin Foo: bass and vocals * Manoj Ramdas: guitars * Jakob Hoyer: drums === ''Pretty in Black'' line-up === * Sune Rose Wagner: guitars, vocals, synth, percussion, drums, bass, and programming * Sharin Foo: vocals and percussion * Jakob Hoyer: drums and percussion * Anders Christensen: bass, percussion, and organ * Manoj Ramdas: guitar === Subsequent line-up === * Sune Rose Wagner: instruments and vocals * Sharin Foo: vocals == Discography == === Studio albums === {| class="wikitable plainrowheaders" style="text-align:center;" |- ! scope="col" rowspan="2"| Year ! scope="col" rowspan="2"| Album details ! scope="col" colspan="7"| Peak chart positions ! scope="col" rowspan="2"| [[List of music recording certifications|Certifications]] |- ! scope="col" style="width:3em;font-size:85%;"|[[Tracklisten|DEN]]

— | style="text-align:center;"| — | |- |2020 |"Snowstorm" | style="text-align:center;"| — | style="text-align:center;"| — | style="text-align:center;"| — | |} === Soundtracks and compilations === *''[[FIFA 2004]]'' (2003) with "That Great Love Sound" *''[[Driv3r]]'' (2004) with "Bowels of the Beast" * ''[[Stubbs the Zombie in Rebel Without a Pulse#Soundtrack|Stubbs the Zombie: The Soundtrack]]'' (2005) with "[[My Boyfriend's Back (song)|My Boyfriend's Back]]" (cover of [[The Angels (American group)|The Angels]]' #1 hit) * ''Nordkraft – Original Soundtrack'' (2005) with "Beat City"{{cite web|url=http://www.discogs.com/Various-Nordkraft-Original-Soundtrack/release/1210459 |title=Various – Nordkraft – Original Soundtrack (CD) at Discogs |publisher=Discogs|access-date=2012-04-23}} * [[Amnesty International]]'s ''Instant Karma'' (2007) with "One Day at a Time" ([[John Lennon]] cover, download only) *''Whip It!
